reviews.review_text:
This place is small with few tables recommended for family & friends also. It has a typical local hut giving it a goan house atmosphere with few tables. I tried the palak paneer here which I would like to highly recommend to the vegetarian lovers. The palak panner was creamy and melting over the taste buds. The veg starter brinjal rawa fry was crispy, spicy and tasty. Another recipe which I would definitely like to recommend is the chicken crumps- a Unique recipe served with mayo. I also tried the chanak thali which was average. The chanak rawa fry in the thali was fresh and fried well However the rice and curry were served cold. This is a local place and kindly note there is no AC here. The service is good and the waiters are well trained. The place is very much inside from the main road but google solves the way out. This place is very affordable and reasonable in cost and provides good quality food.

· Trip type: Friends

· Service: 3.5

· Location: 3.0

· Hotel highlights: Crowder so one should try to be early especially during lunch time·

· Walkability: No walking distance; its Just on the road with street parking service.

· Food & drinks: The food tastes good. We all enjoyed the chicken crumps and palak panner the most.

Went for lunch here.
Great ambience with simplicity.
Service was fast and very good staff.
Food quantity is good with affordable prices.
Chicken crispy 4/5
Chicken leg piece 2/5(Rs.150 which was small and had no great taste ,just simply coated with masala)
Lepo fish thali 3/5
Lemon soda was good
Chicken Biryani 3/5
Inside and outside seating area
Washroom is available

Amazing experience at this local bar. The food is yum, the fish is fresh. Grab local dishes with a chilled beer and your day is done! Try delicious Goan delicacies like Chicken Cafreal and Squids Racheado(must try).
You get the perfect experience of a local bar here. The owner is very friendly and recommends their must try food items. Visit them asap!!
